title: Syncing destroys my homepage every time
content: On my main laptop I built a nice homepage with shortcuts that I use regularly. I would like this exact homepage on all the devices where I sign in with my Firefox account. Instead, every time I sign into a new device and sync, my homepage is completely destroyed and scrambled on all devices, including my main laptop and I have to painstakingly recreate the homepage I want. What is going wrong here? How can I set up one homepage on one device that will be synced to all other devices?
creator: johannes.julius

title: How do I tell if Firefox is or isn't the active window?
content:
One of the most fundamental and necessary functions in a window-based GUI is the ability to tell, at a glance, which is the active window.

Firefox seemingly dropped this essential functionality over a year ago.

When I saw the new colours in today's update, I thought, "finally, they've come to their senses." But apparently not.

How can I force Firefox to look clearly different when it's the active window versus an inactive window?

Please! Anything to make this work the way it should!

(Anticipating that many people might say, "everyone's doing it now," I'd like to point out that just because something is a popular trend does not make it good. Just look at Britain's revolving door of Prime Ministers right now. This particular trend in GUI implementation is a total disaster!)
creator: pstepanas

title: Podcasts won't play;  "This page is slowing your browser." ;  generally, my laptop is slower and slower when using Firefox.
content:

title: Problems Playing Media
content:
I've been unable to play twitter videos at all. For videos and audio posts on other sites, there's usually a delay for a couple seconds before it plays. I disabled all my add-ons and it made no difference. If I try to play 2 different things at once, both of them will chug if play at all.

Does anyone know what the cause might be? I tested videos and audio in another browser and they work fine.
creator: chenanigans

title: Audio popping and crackling whenever starting and stopping media such as videos streams or music
content: I think I've been having this problem for a while now it's much more noticeable on specific headphones or speakers I've tried a wide range of headphones wireless or wired it's all the same I've tried deleting my cash I've tried disabling media webs speech synth I've tried removing all of my extensions running in troubleshoot mode nothing gets rid of the audio piping the only time I could get it my computer to play a YouTube video without popping every time I pause it was when I used a different browser but I really like Firefox so I would love to find a solution but I have tried a lot of things I've tried reinstalling my drivers and I have the problem on my Mac and my Windows computers if anyone has any creative solutions I would very much appreciate the help
creator: stefanjack13

title: My whole firefox installation moved to a temporary link to it after updating
content: So I sometimes run Firefox on windows via a link to the Firefox folder, in the sense of that there is a C:/Programs/Mozilla Firefox2 that is a link to C:/Programs/Mozilla Firefox, and I run C:/Programs/Mozilla Firefox2/firefox.exe. I do this in order to keep two different profiles pinned to the taskbar like two different browsers. However, today I started the second profile first, which I don't usually do, and the updater removed every file except itself from the first folder, converted the second from a symlink to a normal folder and moved the files there. Any idea on how to avoid this?
creator: onwegkarl81

content:
